column4: ssh-vulnkey is showing that my client key is compromised... regenerating it does not change this... what do i do?
ssh-vulnkey is showing that my client key is compromised... regenerating it does not change this... what do i do?
did you upgrade ssh?
yes
pastebin what you are seeing
running ssh-vulnkey is showing that my client key is compromised (~/.ssh/id_rsa)... there is nothing to paste
verify you actually have a new key when you run ssh-keygen
brb
i regenerated it, but it has the same fingerprint
that's not really possible.  How exactly are you generating the key?
maybe i'm not understanding... what exactly does ssh-vulnkey show?
it shows you compromised keys.  You are using that correctly.  But I'm not sure you are generating a new key correctly since it has the same finger print.  What command are you running?
ssh-vulnkey
yes, but to regenerate the key?
ssh-genkey
ssh-keygen you mean?  Make sure you rename the old ~/.ssh/id_rsa and ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub before you use ssh-keygen
example is just find a package and 'apt-get source' it
i would also like to know the best ways to use the packaging helper scripts
that's in the documentation I linked you to.  Poke me if you can't find it
ok, thanks. i'll look it over. you ok with some questions if i can't figure it out?
you should ask #ubuntu-motu about packaging questions, they know more than me about it :)
will do
